alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Hardeman; Haywood; Madison; Shelby; Tipton (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 17 at 1:17PM CST until February 17 at 2:00PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Tipton County in western Tennessee... Fayette County in western Tennessee... Northwestern Hardeman County in western Tennessee... Southern Haywood County in western Tennessee... Southwestern Madison County in western Tennessee... Eastern Shelby County in western Tennessee... * Until 200 PM CST. * At 117 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Covington to Southeast Memphis, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Bartlett, Collierville, Germantown, Bolivar, Cordova, Memphis, Lakeland, Arlington, Whiteville, Somerville, Hillville, Lagrange, Southeast Memphis, Eads, Dancyville, Cloverport, Mercer, Warren, Macon and Oakland. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for northeastern and northwestern Mississippi...and western Tennessee. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for northeastern and northwestern Mississippi...and western Tennessee.

area.areaDesc: Fayette; Hardeman; Haywood; Madison; Shelby; Tipton
